channel.title: Maps & Map Reviews
channel.description: Anything relating to maps or the map review section of our site.

item.title: BR-CBP2-Aquarius Review
item.author: invalid@example.com (Mozi)
item.dc:creator: Mozi
item.content:encoded:
Hey there,

review not to shabby... the score seems low for that quality of a map I would have expected 7-7.5, 6 was kind of harsh....

I dont think its set in stone that BR has to been in open spaces...

about the ball being on the lower level...well it is compensated by jumpads next to it to grab the ball and go back up and keep running or jump down and grab the ball and run the lower route

thats my thoughts...but hey I guess its your review your opinion...everyone is...

BR-CBP2-Aquarius Review

item.title: AS-Confexia IS OUT!
item.author: invalid@example.com (BobTheDog)
item.dc:creator: BobTheDog
item.content:encoded:
Ya know ya want it!

Forum Thread with Shots and Download HERE

Things to keep in mind:

1. It's about 40.1 MB zipped and about 75.6 MB unzipped!

2. It's substantially longer than any AS map before it, taking on average 15-25 minutes to complete, so make usre to adjust your round timers to ccomodate it!

item.title: Looking for UT Deathmatch Map
item.author: invalid@example.com (jasonehand)
item.dc:creator: jasonehand
item.content:encoded:
I played a map years ago back in 1999-2000 that had a giant staircase like a mile up with sniper rifles and ammo at the top. There was a transporter at the bottom that transported you to the top of the staircase sniper area, right in the back of the sniper (the first person that made it to the top of the staircase), we would race eachother to the top to be the first one up so we can do "headshots" on everyone else trying to get up.

Does anyone know the name of that map or have a link to...

Looking for UT Deathmatch Map

item.title: DM-WalmPack
item.author: invalid@example.com (SkaarjMaster)
item.dc:creator: SkaarjMaster
item.content:encoded:
Well, I finally got a chance to play the maps in this pack and can't post comments on the review anymore, so here are some brief comments on each map.

DM-CloudConnected >> interesting, small, good architecture, good rockin' tune, I like the addition of the sniper nest and don't fall.
DM-Fotze >> interesting and small duel map, good lighting and edges, nice ambient sounds and effects. No problem getting items and weapons in this one.
DM-Mindkiller >> good one! ramps and goo everywhere!...

DM-WalmPack

item.title: UT map review links!
item.author: invalid@example.com (SkaarjMaster)
item.dc:creator: SkaarjMaster
item.content:encoded:
All my reviews (UT or UT2003) should now link correctly (except for DM-Tresthe for some odd reason; try link at bottom of review instead). BUFBonusPack1 links to the Cogworks download though.

Anyone trying to DL UT maps from Insite reviews just has to make sure "dl.php" is linked in the PHP part of the URL and that "insite/ut" also appears somewhere in the link. Sometimes the beginning part needs to have "www.beyondunreal.com" or "insite.beyondunreal.com" also. I believe any UT map...

UT map review links!

item.title: ONS-Agamendon[Monsters]
item.author: invalid@example.com (cosmix)
item.dc:creator: cosmix
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I want to introduce a map I had build on for overall a year.
On this map I tried out a lot new stuff. It's an Onslaught battle but there is no terrain e.g.
Further I worked with some interesting technics like physics, new vehicles and monsters and embedded them into the map.
At last there is only one single file needed to play the map.


[SCREENSHOT]http://www.alice-dsl.net/thorsten.hamann/AgamendonMonsters/Draufsicht.jpg[/SCREENSHOT]

Top view of the map (click to enlarge)....

ONS-Agamendon[Monsters]

item.title: Thoughts on AS-Confexia
item.author: invalid@example.com (BobTheDog)
item.dc:creator: BobTheDog
item.content:encoded:
Just thought I'd post a list of my thought on this much-anticipated map, and get yours as well.

Basic layout seems good. I like the architechture... neo-apocalyptica allways looks good in UT, ey ^_^ GREAT intro!

The first flaw I did notice was the utter LACK of vehicles. This map is fronted as a vehicle-centric map, but the assaulters don't initially have access to very many vehicles other than a few Mantas and a couple of Scorpions, easy prey for the Defense. This makes the initial...

Thoughts on AS-Confexia

item.title: DM-UCMP-1on1-Derelict
item.author: invalid@example.com (barballs)
item.dc:creator: barballs
item.content:encoded:
Name: DM-UCMP-1on1-Derelict
Version: 1.0
Compatibility: UT2004

Description: Forgotten and desolate, this once productive facility was thought to be of no more use to any. That was untill a Liandri Corp mining team came accoss it. Quickly adapted, it fit right into the one on one championship roster. As nicknamed by those who've shed the blood of others in this decrepid tomb of past industry, Derelict is fast becoming one of the most popular one on one venues...

DM-UCMP-1on1-Derelict

item.title: DM-1on1-Agitation110V2
item.author: invalid@example.com (kAoS.Druzilla)
item.dc:creator: kAoS.Druzilla
item.content:encoded:
Name: DM-1on1-Agitation110V2

Version: Final

Compatibility: Unreal Tournament 2004

Description: This is a remake of DM-1on1-Agitation110 by Derek "D.J.P." Paredes, basically i have changed the gameplay for faster more fluid action, with the single idea of speed, making this map a bit harder a lot of fun to play.

Comments: This is my first go at mapping i thought i did well

Screenshot:...

DM-1on1-Agitation110V2

item.title: DM-Talus *Final Release*
item.author: invalid@example.com (_Algol_)
item.dc:creator: _Algol_
item.content:encoded:
Hi--this is the same map as is showing up elsewhere...trying not to annoy the heck outta people, but also trying to pimp a little bit.

So.......
Finally finished my first unreal tournament map.

Map is entirely stock static meshes and textures, with the exception of the two starfield textures in the skybox....I made those.

2-4 players, no bio rifle, no superweapons, no ONS weapons. Contains the rest of the standard DM weapons.

Requires UT04, most recent patch...

DM-Talus *Final Release*

item.title: DM-1on1-Oblivion2k4
item.author: invalid@example.com (Homeslice)
item.dc:creator: Homeslice
item.content:encoded: Seems like lots of people were angry at that review (I haven't tried the map yet though), but we shouldn't have the flaming occur at Insite, so if anyone needs to vent and/or defend themselves, then do it here.

item.title: I'm getting really badly bashed for my review of CTF-Aron....
item.author: invalid@example.com (Homeslice)
item.dc:creator: Homeslice
item.content:encoded: Seems like everyone will agree with Deathbliss that the score should've been higher, because the mapper was Hourences. How dare he say I am drunk! That was uncalled for. I've taken heat as a reviewer many times, but not like that. I'm just fuming, pardon me, but I am just speaking my mind here. Need some advice.

item.title: DM-Reassimilation
item.author: invalid@example.com (cUnNiNg_StUnTs)
item.dc:creator: cUnNiNg_StUnTs
item.content:encoded:
DM-Reassimilation

This is my first released map for Unreal Tournament 2004. (released in July) It is a remake of a Q3A map by the same name otherwise known as charon3dm3. It is a small death match map that is suitable for 1on1 but the layout will hold many more. Once at the burial-grounds Q3A server we had a 40+ frag fest on the original. It's intended to be a tribute to the original yet complement the enhanced game play...

DM-Reassimilation

item.title: Vctf-experimental flew away?
item.author: invalid@example.com (RedPill)
item.dc:creator: RedPill
item.content:encoded:
hey there was just wondering i got an email saying my map had been reviewed but now the link says it dosent exist did some one make a booboo and post it up by accident i did get the chance to read it though and it was a fair review so thanks to homeslice

p.s
i dont really like vctf which i guess is why so few vehicles

item.title: CTC Volume 1 released!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Homeslice)
item.dc:creator: Homeslice
item.content:encoded:
Volume 1 of the CTC (Community Tribute Classic) by the boys of Unreal Playground (www.unrealplayground.com) has been released. It contains 4 Deathmatch Maps, 1 Capture the Flag Map, and 1 JailBreak Map. The maps are:

DM-CTC-EBD-HammerV1.4 by evil_blue_dude
DM-CTC-Scios by Nils "Flying_Killer" Croes
CTF-CTC-Helimania by Francis "Fritz-X" De Block
DM-CTC-Croon by Lucas "L.J.Paranoid" Hassen
DM-CTC-The_Spinner by Tex "TexasGtar" Brown
JB-CTC-EBD-Theomachy by evil_blue_dude...

CTC Volume 1 released!

item.title: Is a map 1on1 or not?
item.author: invalid@example.com (SkaarjMaster)
item.dc:creator: SkaarjMaster
item.content:encoded:
It was suggested we start a forum thread on this topic, so here it is. Everyone on the Team feel free to cut and paste from the pre-comments for DM-1on1-Mosaic2004.

It just defies all logic that's all. If a map IS truly a 1on1 map, the default bot load should be 1. You can make your 1on1 maps and big as you want, but if the default bot load is not 1 then the 1on1 should be left out of the title. I know a lot of mappers do it, but that doesn't mean it's right. I'm sorry if I offend anyone,...

Is a map 1on1 or not?
